Dear Ms. Aufdemberge:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 734-395-0920.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 told Youth S that if Youth S hits her, she would hit her
back.
Investigation I interviewed Team Leader, who is also the Complainant, with the
Rights Officer present. On 02/07/23 at 2:30pm, she said she
walked onto A wing and witnessed Staff 1 and Youth S arguing
back and forth. “Staff 1 told Youth S she would beat her ass and
said, ‘I don’t give a fuck about this job.’” An unidentified staff was
physically holding or pulling Staff 1 back from Youth S. Another
staff was holding or pulling Youth S back from Staff 1. “I locked
my elbow with Staff 1 and walked her (off of the wing) to the
conference room. It took Staff 1 awhile to calm down.”
On 2/8/23, Rights Officer notified me Vista Maria had placed Staff
1 on administrative leave. Rights Officer attempted to reach her
to facilitate a face-to-face interview, but she did not respond. Staff
1’s employment was terminated on 2/10/23. Prior to being
terminated, Rights Officer indicated she wrote a statement
describing the incident.
2

I interviewed Youth S with the Rights Officer present. According
to Youth S, Staff 1 picked up the Target Book and “went off” on
her. “She said she don’t give a fuck about this job and stop
fucking talking to her. I don’t know what I did. She (Staff 1) stood
up and threw her purse on the table. I took it as a physical threat.
She asked, ‘You wanna fight?’ Staff 2 and 3 got in front of her
and held her back while talking to her. They made her go off the
wing.”
I interviewed Staff 2 with the Rights Officer present. She said
Youth S confronted Staff 1 for “writing her up.” “Staff 1 said ‘I
don’t give a fuck’ and told Youth S that she was disrespectful.
Youth S cussed at Staff 1. Staff 1 was raising her voice. Staff 1
put her glasses down so they wouldn’t get broken. I tried to
intervene as well as Staff 3…My interventions were directed
toward Youth S. Staff 3 asked Staff 1 to calm down and walk to
the conference room.” I asked if Staff 1 threatened to hit Youth S.
She said Staff 1 threatened, “If you put your hands on me, I’ll put
my hands on you.” I asked if Staff 1 threw her purse on a table.
Staff 2 said Staff 1 did not have a purse.
Staff 1 did not avail herself for a face-to-face interview prior to
being terminated. The following are excerpts from her written
account of the incident on 2/7/23:
I, Staff 1, got into a verbal confrontation on A wing…with
Youth S. Youth S became upset with me at school for
redirecting her more than once…I had a sheet that I wrote
negatives on pertaining to Youth S’ behavior and other
students. When it was time to go back to the building from
the school, Youth S refused to ‘buddy’ (link arms with staff or
another youth) …She started using profanity… I didn’t want
it to escalate so I left it alone and let the school staff handle
it.
When we returned to the building, I…was told to do an
incident report. I took the computer to A wing because I had
to get the Target Book to write my negatives. Youth S…tried
talking to me asking who I was doing an incident report on…
I was not at liberty to discuss that…and wasn’t going to even
if I was. Youth S began trying to talk… and argue with me
about how I be doing too much and how I get on her nerves.
I explained to her that if I’m doing too much, I know I must
be doing my job. I did not give in to the profanity that was
being used toward me… until I felt threatened by Youth S.
3

Youth S began to walk toward me using profanity and saying
how she would put her hands on me. I told Youth S that she
doesn’t scare me and if she does put her hands on me, I
would put my hands back on her and hand in my badge.
Youth S kept trying to argue and finally I had to be the bigger
person and go into the conference room with my coworker to
cool off…I know I was wrong when I said I would put my
hands back on her but that was my way of protecting myself
because Youth S has been known to put her hands on not
only peers but staff as well. If I ever felt it had to come to
that, I would definitely talk with my supervisor, but I said
what I thought would keep Youth S from actually physically
attacking me.
Analysis Former Staff 1 lost control and responded with a verbal threat
when she felt physically threatened by Youth S. Vista Maria
placed the staff on administrative leave on 2/7/23 and terminated
her on 2/20/23.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
